newsitem.title: USA: Investment firm manager sees tech bargains-report.
newsitem.headline: Investment firm manager sees tech bargains-report.

text.p: Investment firm manager Roger McNamee sees selective bargains in slumping technology stocks, reported Barron's, a financial weekly.
Technology stock values have been hurt by overcapacity in the semiconductor business, product transitions in networking companies, and the recent demise of momentum investvesting, Barron's said.

McNamee, a partner in Integral Capital Partners and a former manager of T. Rowe Price's Science & Technology fund, told the paper, "From a valuation perspective, the excesses have been wrung out....The number of companies down 70 percent to 80 percent from their 52-week highs is just staggering.
"Many deserved it, but the selling is just indescriminate," McNamee told the paper.

Partnerships managed by Integral Capital Partners own shares in Sierra Semiconductor Corp, Linear Technology Corp, Ascend Communications Inc, Cisco Systems, Intel Corp, Dell Computer Corp , Remedy Corp, Oracle Corp, Microsoft Corp, and 3Com Corp among others.
McNamee told the paper that he invests with three key themes in mind: connectivity, interactivity and mobility.
